document.heading: District of Columbia Act on the Aging

history.narrative: Law 1-24, the “District of Columbia Act on the Aging,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 1-106, which was referred to the Committee on Human Resources and Aging. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 17, 1975 and July 1, 1975, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 25, 1975, it was assigned Act No. 1-36 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
